item.title: WLFI: Blacklisted 272 Addresses to Protect User Asset Security, Will Never Ban an Account for Participating Normally in the Market
item.description: September 6th: The Trump family's crypto project World Liberty Fi officially announced on social media that their team has been closely following the community's recent concerns about wallet blacklisting. The fundamental principle is transparency. That is to say, WLFI only takes measures to protect users and never interferes with normal activities. In the past few days, a total of 272 wallets have been blacklisted, which only accounts for a very small proportion of the total holders. This action is purely a temporary measure taken to prevent harm during the investigation and to assist affected users. Among these 272 addresses:· 215 (approximately 79.0%) are related to phishing attacks. The team took proactive measures to prevent hackers from transferring funds and is working with legitimate owners to ensure the safety/transfer of assets.· 50 (approximately 18.4%) were reported stolen by owners through support channels, and the team implemented blacklisting at their request.The WL

item.title: A newly created address deposited 3 million U to open a 20x ETH long position on Hyperliquid.
item.description: Update, September 6th. According to the monitoring of Onchain Lens, a newly created wallet address deposited 3 million USDC into Hyperliquid and opened a 20x leveraged long position in ETH. The specific data is as follows:· Position Size: 7174 ETH· Position Value: $30.8 million· Entry Price: $4292· Liquidation Price: $3954

item.title: Influenced by the Coinbase listing roadmap, NOICE Skyrockets by 155%
item.description: On September 6th, based on market data, due to its listing on the Coinbase exchange, Noice (NOICE) witnessed a short-term sharp increase of 155%. It is currently trading at $0.0003 and has a market capitalization of $17.25 million.

item.title: Trump Signs Executive Order to Adjust Tariff Policy Scope
item.description: On September 6th, according to a statement from the White House, US President Trump signed an executive order to adjust the scope of import tariffs and implement trade and security framework agreements with foreign trading partners. The executive order stipulates that after reaching a framework agreement or a final agreement with foreign trading partners, the US may adjust tariffs in accordance with the agreement. This includes reducing equivalent tariffs to zero for some goods. However, the tariff scope is generally not narrowed or the Section 232 tariffs (steel and aluminum derivative tariffs) modified before the signing of the final agreement. Goods eligible for zero equivalent tariffs include products that cannot be produced in the US or are produced in insufficient quantities to meet domestic demand, specific agricultural products, aircraft and parts, and non-patented items for pharmaceutical applications. (CCTV News)

item.title: Coinbase Listing Roadmap Update: Keeta (KTA) and Noice (NOICE)
item.description: On September 6th, according to official channels, Coinbase's listing plan has included Keeta (KTA) and Noice (NOICE).

item.title: Ethena Foundation Initiates New $310 Million Buyback Program
item.description: On September 6th, Ethena made an announcement regarding an additional $530 million "StablecoinX" PIPE transaction. Additionally, the foundation initiated a new $310 million open market buyback program.BlockBeats had previously reported that on July 21st, the stablecoin issuer StablecoinX company announced the completion of a $360 million financing round for the acquisition of ENA tokens. It also planned to list Class A common stock on the Nasdaq Global Market under the ticker symbol "USDE". The Ethena Foundation would contribute $60 million worth of ENA tokens.To commence the buyback program, StablecoinX would utilize the $260 million net cash proceeds (after deducting relevant expenses) from the financing to purchase locked ENA tokens from the subsidiary of the Ethena Foundation.

item.title: Republican Lawmakers Consider Rule Change to Create Fast Track for Trump's Fed Board Nominees
item.description: September 6th: An aide in the U.S. Senate from the Republican Party stated that Senate Republicans are in the process of contemplating a change in the rules in order to establish a fast-track confirmation procedure for Trump's nominees to the Federal Reserve Board. The potential new rules may potentially be debated as early as the beginning of the next month. (Kyodo News)

item.title: Trump Suggests Fed Chair Nominee Will Be Announced Soon
item.description: September 6th, Market News: Trump Indicates That He Will Soon Make an Announcement Regarding the Nominee for the Chair of the Federal Reserve. (Xinhua)

item.title: The draft bill from the U.S. Senate Banking Committee would exclude Staking, Airdrops, and Decentralized Entity Infrastructure Networks from securities law.
item.description: On September 6th, based on market information, a draft bill presented by the U.S. Senate Banking Committee is set to exclude staking, airdrops, and decentralized entity infrastructure networks from the purview of securities laws.

item.title: ENA Short-Term Surge Exceeds 6%, Market Cap Rises to $48.33 Billion
item.description: On September 6th. Possibly influenced by the news that "The Ethena Foundation Launches a New $3.1 Billion Buyback Plan" (link: https://www.theblockbeats.info/flash/310999), ENA saw a temporary surge of more than 6%, with its market capitalization rising to $48.33 billion.
